banner.title: TP WorkLife 10/12
banner.mainContentHeadline: The podcast where science meets business
banner.mainContent: From fixing meetings to finding a mentor, get new insights to help you enjoy your time at work and thrive in your career.

videoData.title: From Beethoven to Kinect, linking music to our bodies
videoData.socialTitle: From Beethoven to Kinect, linking music to our bodies

nodes.whoTheyAre: Peter Kirn is an electronic musician and creative technologist. Classically trained as a pianist and composer, he now produces experimental/ambient music and live techno. He is known as a creative tech journalist and editor of Created Digital Music (CDM), which for ten years has been a hub for covering expressive technologies for music and visual performance. He is co-creator of the open source MeeBlip synthesizer hardware.

videoData.description: Creative technologist Peter Kirn contemplates the intimate connection between the corporeal and emotional worlds through music. He discusses the physical impact of Beethoven's symphonies, concluding with a live demonstration of an instrument that registers the body's response and generates sound based solely on his physical movements.
videoData.socialDescription: Creative technologist Peter Kirn contemplates the intimate connection between the corporeal and emotional worlds through music. He discusses the physical impact of Beethoven's symphonies, concluding with a live demonstration of an instrument that registers the body's response and generates sound based solely on his physical movements.
